metadata.title: CVE-2022-1184 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in fs/ext4/namei.c:dx_insert_block() in theLinux kernelâ€™s filesystem sub-component. This flaw allows a local attackerwith a user privilege to cause a denial of service.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1184` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.1.0-16-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-6.1.0-16-generic-lpae - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-16-generic - 6.1.0-16.16
linux-image-unsigned-6.1.0-16-generic-64k - 6.1.0-16.16
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-kvm - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-aws - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-azure - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1004-gcp - 6.2.0-1004.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1001-ibm - 6.2.0-1001.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-oracle - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-6.2.0-1003-raspi - 6.2.0-1003.3
linux-image-6.2.0-1003-raspi-nolpae - 6.2.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-lowlatency - 6.2.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1002-lowlatency-64k - 6.2.0-1002.2
No subscription required
